title: Crimson Tide 1978 Crimson Tide - Reckess Love 1979
description:
Crimson Tide, a band lead by yet another Southern legend: Wayne Perkins.
Wayne Perkins is, like Steve Cropper and Pete Carr, one of the great 
session guitarists of that great melting pot of Southern music. He's been 
a Muscle Shoals picker and has played with loads of greats. He was also 
the lead guitarist spicing up the "Black & Blue" album by the Stones.
Crimson Tide was a band Wayne had with his brother Dale. They released 
two albums, Crimson Tide being the first. Once you get past the slickness, you'll find a really great album, full of splendid picking and singing. It's a 
little bit of everything on this album, but that's the way I like it best. 
There's soul, there's rock, some funk and all Southern flavored.

"Reckless Love" is the second and final album by Wayne Perkins' Crimson Tide. 
A band formed with his brother Dale after having played a lot as session 
guitarist. It's another good album, which may sound too slick for some, but 
it more than makes up by some excellent playing. The music ranges from Funk 
Rock to AOR to Southern Rock. Some marvelous songs too. 
I hope so. So, sit you down and listen to the guitar antics of Wayne Perkins.
